(Same as CPLT 751R 6)
FREN 770: Health Humanities
Bruy√®re (Mondays 1:00-4:00pm, in person)
Content: In this seminar, the emergent field of Health Humanities serves as a platform to both think about the pressure to be interdisciplinary scholars in precarious times and reabsorb some of it in the form of innovative close readings of canonical texts and films. A focus on temporality will allow us to make provisions for notions of demographic transition, chronic illness, and health crisis in the critical repertoire of affect studies, visual culture, and literary criticism. Taught in English.
sections: Class Nbr: 5291, Section #: 1, Type: SEM, Campus: ATL, Meets: M 1-4p, Instructor: V. Bruyere, Status: Open
